Method Detail

dna2protein

public static final java.lang.String dna2protein(java.lang.String dna,
                                                 boolean cropStopCodon)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts string of nuceic acids into string of amino acids. If the string is not of length modulus 3 then it's end is modified: if has 2 of the 3 final bases then an N is appended, however, if it only has 1 then that is removed.

Parameters:
dna - string of nucleic acids. Supports upper and lower case characters.
cropStopCodon - do not create amino acids for and after stop codon id present in dna.
Returns:
string of amino acids.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

dna2protein

public static final byte[] dna2protein(byte[] dna)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

codon2aminoAcid

public static java.lang.String codon2aminoAcid(java.lang.String codon)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts 3 nuceic acids into an amino acid. If codon is unrecognised, e.g. "ANN" then "X" is returned.

Parameters:
codon - 3 nucleic acids. Supports upper and lower case characters.
Returns:
amino acid.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - codon string is wrong length.

reverseComplement

public static java.lang.String reverseComplement(java.lang.String dna)
Reverses the string and complements each base.

Parameters:
dna -
Returns:
reverse complement of dna

reverseComplement

public static byte[] reverseComplement(byte[] dna)

replaceSubSequence

public static java.lang.String replaceSubSequence(java.lang.String sourceSeq,
                                                  Location sourceLoc,
                                                  java.lang.String replacementSeq,
                                                  Location replacementLoc)
Replace a sub sequence from sourceSeq with replacementSeq. The replacementLoc defines the part of sourceSeq to replace. Handles the situation where sourceSeq and replacementSeq on different strands.

Parameters:
sourceSeq - original sequence string.
sourceLoc - genomic location of source sequence.
replacementSeq - sequence with which to replace the part of sourceSeq corresponding to replacementLoc.
replacementLoc - genomic location for replacementSeq.
Returns:
string corresponding to the insertion of replacementSeq in sourceSeq.
